channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.description: The global death toll from coronavirus has passed 413,000 and there are more than 7.2 million known cases of infection, according to Johns Hopkins University.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: Global COVID-19 cases surpass 7.2 million, Australian death toll stands at 102

item.description: Nationwide protests over George Floyd's death with no social distancing could lead to another spike in cases in coming weeks. Deaths have surpassed 112,000.
item.title: Coronavirus cases in the US now top 2 million

item.description: Tesla shares jump over $US1000 after an email to staff was leaked, making the company the second-most valuable carmaker in the world.
item.title: Tesla shares rocket as Elon Musk says Semi truck is ready for 'volume production'

item.dc:creator: Latika Bourke
item.description: The Harry Potter author said she refused to concede to a movement that was seeking to erode women and offering "cover to predators".
item.title: 'I refuse to bow down': J.K. Rowling takes on trans activists in essay

item.description: In their first economic projections this year, the Fed has predicted a slower path back to economic strength than the Trump administration — and perhaps the stock market — seems to expect.
item.title: 'Great uncertainty about the future': Fed predicts slow recovery, years of high unemployment

item.dc:creator: Charlotte Grieve
item.description: The world's largest insurance broker has been trying to secure cover for the controversial Adani mine since 2015.
item.title: 'Kept under lock and key': Adani secures insurer support for Carmichael mine

item.description: Former US District Judge John Gleeson said that the government had "engaged in highly irregular conduct to benefit a political ally of the President".
item.title: Ex-judge says push to dismiss Michael Flynn case is abuse of power

item.dc:creator: Matt Bungard
item.description: Streaming provider Netflix has removed four of Australian comedian Chris Lilley's programs from its library, amid debate over his portrayal of non-white characters.
item.title: Netflix removes four Chris Lilley shows from library

item.description: Are You Tougher Than Your Ancestors is basically an attempt to make history look like fun.
item.title: What's on TV: Monday June 15

item.dc:creator: Alexandra Smith
item.description: Deputy Premier John Barilaro says people are no longer prepared to put up with inconsistencies around health restrictions.
item.title: Berejiklian, Barilaro clash over easing coronavirus restrictions

item.dc:creator: Chris Barrett
item.description: The head of Australian cricket’s most powerful state wants a rare meeting of the Australian Cricket Council amid division over cricket's reaction to COVID-19.
item.title: NSW supremo calls on Cricket Australia to convene game's national cabinet

item.dc:creator: Megan Gorrey
item.description: Ask most Sydneysiders about Mosman and they might echo the sentiment that the suburb is not the same as gritty, colourful Newtown in the inner west.
item.title: Mosman is not Newtown: Council raises concerns over Woolworths plan

item.dc:creator: Peter FitzSimons
item.description: With a TV deal in place for 2020 the point remains: there will never be a better time for rugby to tweak its rules to make it a better game.
item.title: It's time to stop rugby's rules ruling the game

item.description: Australians of all colours, creeds and ethnicities should ask the true owners of our land if they accept the Australian constitution.
item.title: Nothing should get in the way of a march to justice

item.description: Trivia buffs: test your knowledge with today's interactive superquiz and target.
item.title: Target and superquiz, Thursday, June 11

item.description: After a long wait, punters and venues are getting back into the AFL spirit ahead of the Richmond v Collingwood clash at the MCG on Thursday evening.
item.title: 'It's been so long': Home game for all as AFL fans gear up for couch clash

item.dc:creator: Lucy Stone
item.description: Former deputy premier Jackie Trad, Greens councillor Jonathan Sri, cycling lobby groups and the council have all expressed concern about the intersection design for new signals on Gladstone Road.
item.title: Fears for students' safety due to Dutton Park intersection upgrade

item.description: Free daily horoscope for each star sign from renowned Astrologer Hedy Damari. Forecasts for the day ahead in life, love and career.
item.title: Your Daily Horoscope for Thursday, June 11

item.dc:creator: Angus Thompson
item.description: Transport officials say they are finalising plans for cycle ramps at the north and south ends of the Sydney Harbour Bridge more than two years after community opposition sidelined the project.
item.title: New plan for cyclists on Harbour Bridge ramping up

item.dc:creator: Jessica Irvine
item.description: The success of the government's coronavirus support is something to celebrate – but not to perpetuate.
item.title: JobKeeper is not a keeper, so let's start the weaning phase

item.dc:creator: Pru Goward
item.description: The tragedy of some members of the transgender movement attacking feminists is that they are their most willing fellow travellers.
item.title: Feminists like JK Rowling struggle with the transgender movement, but they should not be silenced

item.dc:creator: Samantha Selinger-Morris
item.description: What are the new rules of office engagement, post-COVID-19? Radically different, and possibly kinder.
item.title: Better chat, more play: the new workplace etiquette rules

item.dc:creator: Nigel Gladstone
item.description: NSW was the first state to switch poker machines on after COVID-19 lockdown – and in their first week back punters have been hitting them hard.
item.title: Pokie turnover higher in first week after lockdown than before COVID-19

item.dc:creator: Patrick Hatch
item.description: Dire warning for holders of $2 billion worth of Virgin's unsecured debt comes as the airline's administrator Deloitte push the federal government for a financial lifeline.
item.title: Virgin bondholders 'will get nothing' after failed creditor play

item.dc:creator: Cara Waters
item.description: Airtree Ventures partner James Cameron says the local startup sector may have to shed more jobs if the program comes to an end without proper policies in place.
item.title: Startups will need help once JobKeeper disappears

item.dc:creator: Lucy Stone
item.description: Deputy Premier Steven Miles said he was in regular contact with the AMAQ and the integrated electronic medical record rollout had been paused last year.
item.title: Doctors demand 'credible, independent review' of troubled health record system

item.description: British entertainer Gracie Fields enthralled crowds in Sydney at the start of her Australian tour entertaining armed servicemen and servicewomen.
item.title: From the Archives 1945: Gracie Fields mobbed by cheering Sydney crowds

item.dc:creator: Michael Lallo
item.description: The Sunrise anchor made his name on television - but he'll never depend on it for a living.
item.title: How David Koch became Australia's most successful breakfast TV host

item.dc:creator: Samantha Hutchinson
item.description: The North Sydney pool saga continues ... and continues ... and continues.
item.title: Mayor tries to plug leaks over 'pedestrian' Sydney pool plan

item.dc:creator: Melanie Kembrey
item.description: Silvey's highly anticipated book will go head-to-head on the shelves with the year's other big-ticket novel.
item.title: Craig Silvey's first novel in a decade, Honeybee, to be released in October

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted by our talented artists, illustrators and cartoonists.
item.title: Best of cartoons, June 11, 2020

item.dc:creator: Matt O'Sullivan
item.description: Delivery of the "gateway project" was a condition of planning approval for the second stage of WestConnex, which will open to motorists as early as next month.
item.title: Project to stop WestConnex traffic clogging Newtown stuck in slow lane

item.dc:creator: Chip Le Grand
item.description: The Victorian government has refused an exemption to allow more people to attend the funeral of Indigenous elder Elizabeth Fitzgerald.
item.title: Funeral exemption denied for much-loved Indigenous elder

item.dc:creator: Colin Kruger
item.description: The Boroondora City Council in city's east blamed a systems error for an email threatening its library members with debt collectors over late penalties.
item.title: Library member debt threat was a systems error, Melbourne council says

item.description: Sweden has dropped its investigation into the unsolved murder of the former prime minister, saying that decision was made because the main suspect died in 2000.
item.title: Sweden halts investigation into 1986 murder of PM Olof Palme

item.description: Understanding the precise effect of the pandemic on family violence may be more complex than first thought.
item.title: Did lockdown really trigger an upsurge in family violence?

item.dc:creator: Noel Towell
item.description: The normally surefooted Andrews and his team have been making some uncharacteristic missteps on Belt and Road and, more recently, COVID-19 restrictions in the context of anti-racism protests in Melbourne.
item.title: Is the (second) honeymoon over for Daniel Andrews?

item.dc:creator: David Crowe
item.description: Liberal electorates were some of the big winners from a Morrison government program to back Australian exporters before the last election.
item.title: Labor claims export grants program was used to 'win election'

item.dc:creator: David Crowe
item.description: Indigenous leader Professor Tom Calma has been calling for years for action on reducing incarceration rates but says nothing is changing.
item.title: 'Nothing changes': Indigenous leader wants action on incarceration rate

item.dc:creator: Eryk Bagshaw
item.description: The first signs are emerging that warnings from Beijing will have an impact on student numbers, posing a threat to $3.1 billion in university fee revenue.
item.title: 'Chinese students will not go there': Beijing education agents warn Australia

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted in the work of our award-winning cartoonists.
item.title: Today's cartoons: The illustrated news

item.description: More than $60,000 has been raised for the victims of deadly blaze at a holiday home in regional Victoria.
item.title: Tributes flow for family after fatal holiday house fire

item.dc:creator: Anthony Galloway
item.description: Raff Ciccone wants Australia to accept Hong Kong refugees and diversify away from China to prevent trade being used "to secure our silence against injustice".
item.title: Diversify from China to stop trade being used as 'a weapon' Labor senator says

item.dc:creator: Max Koslowski
item.description: A drastic increase in racism complaints has seen a coalition of 30 community groups join to demand a bipartisan national anti-racism strategy.
item.title: 'A wake-up call and opportunity': Call for a national anti-racism strategy as complaints spike

item.dc:creator: Rachel Eddie
item.description: A mother and son found dead in Notting Hill last month were not killed in a murder-suicide, police have confirmed.
item.title: Deaths of mother and son not suspicious, police say

item.description: In one's opinion.
item.title: It's a Mid North Coast monopoly!

item.dc:creator: Rachael Dexter
item.description: The global death toll from coronavirus has passed 408,000 and there are more than 7.1 million known cases of infection, according to Johns Hopkins University.
item.title: As it happened: Prime Minister urges states and territories to open borders in July, 7 new cases in Australia

item.description: HBO Max has temporarily removed Gone With the Wind from its catalogue after the screenwriter of 12 Years a Slave called on the company to delete it from the list.
item.title: Gone with the Wind gone from the HBO stream after Hollywood outcry

item.description: Roger Federer will miss the rest of the 2020 season after undergoing a second procedure on his right knee.
item.title: Federer to miss rest of season after second knee op

item.dc:creator: Chris Barrett
item.description: First it was names and numbers on the back of Test shirts, now sponsors’ logos have been permitted across the front of them by the ICC.
item.title: Sign of the times: Cricket breaks with tradition to allow sponsors on Test shirts
